Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Protection Division (RPD) erred in rejecting the applicant's claims under sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's history of abuse in Saint Vincent; living arrangement with mother in Canada
Decision_Outcome: RPD rejected the applicant's refugee claim
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate a well-founded fear of persecution or risk to life
Credibility_Factor: RPD considered prospective safety with mother in Canada
Legal_Rule: Sections 96 and 97 of IRPA define 'refugee' and 'person in need of protection'; assessment must be based on prospective risk
Procedural_Issue: Assessment of RPD decision for reasonableness
Grounds_for_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution due to past abuse in Saint Vincent
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RPD's focus on future circumstances deemed reasonable
Key_Evidence_Considered: Past abuse in Saint Vincent; plan to return with mother
Applicant_Challenge: RPD failed to properly assess risk based on past events
Defendant_Response: Returning with mother mitigates prior risks
Outcome: No error found; RPD decision upheld
Remedy_Sought: Certification of question and overturning of RPD decision
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of IRPA
Applicable_Process: Refugee determination process followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: Prospective risk assessment standard in refugee claims
